data.text: The removal of blood from a vein, usually with a needle and syringe or other container, for diagnostic or therapeutic purposes, as in the treatment of hemochomatosis.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: The removal of blood from a vein with a cutting instrument, formerly done to reduce blood volume as a treatment of disease.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: The act or practice of opening a vein for letting blood, as a remedy for disease or with a view to the preservation of health.
The act or practice of opening a vein for letting blood, in the treatment of disease; venesection; bloodletting.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: The opening of a <xref>vein</xref>, either to withdraw <xref>blood</xref> or for letting blood; <xref>venesection</xref>.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: surgical incision into a vein; used to treat hemochromatosis
data.attributionText: from WordNet 3.0 Copyright 2006 by Princeton University. All rights reserved.
